element.name: Stardust by toczygroszek (adopted by AbbeyAckbar), Multi-cache (2.5/1.5)

long-description.p:
The Stardust fire is one of the worst fires Dublin and Ireland has ever seen in modern times.
At 01:41 a.m. on Valentine's Day 1981 in the Stardust Nightclub in Artane (Butterly Business Park, Kilmore Road), while the club was full of people (about 841), inside the building the fire was noticed. It was claimed to have been started by a slashed seat cover allowing a flame to ignite the foam beneath, paper decorations for the Valentine's Night celebrations, causing the entire building to catch fire. In this tragedy 48 people died and 214 were injured.
Because some of the main fire exits turned out to be locked with padlocks and chains, people tried to escape through the men's toilets but the windows there had metal plates fixed on the inside and iron bars on the outside. Seven people died in the toilets while the fire services attempted to rescue them.
It is believed that the fire was caused by arson, what has never been proven.

1st stage:
The coordinates will bring you to a plaque. You need to collect some information from the plaque:
1. How many letters "L" is on the plaque? Call it A.
Go to 2nd stage at coordinates:
N53° 23.795 W006° 12.486
2nd stage:
The coordinates will bring you to a sculpture with a plaque. You need to collect some information from the plaque:
1. How many letters "R" is on the plaque? Call it B.
2. How many letters "P" is on the plaque? Call it C.
3. How many letters "A" is on the plaque? Call it D.
Go to 3rd stage at coordinates:
N53° 23.ABC W006° 12.CAD
3rd stage:
The coordinates will bring you to another plaque. You need to collect some information from the plaque:
1. How many letters "V" is on the plaque? Call it E.
2. How many letters "G" is on the plaque? Call it F.
3. How many letters "W" is on the plaque? Call it G.
Go to 4th stage at coordinates:
N53° 23.AE(E+F) W006° 12.FF(C-G)
4th stage:
You need to find there well hidden coordinates for the final location.
Final location:
Final cache is hidden close to Butterly Business Park where Stardust Nightclub was existed. The cache is a small size container & includes a logbook with space for a couple of small items. Bring a writing tool
PLEASE rehide well to prevent it being muggled. This area is popular with children playing and hanging around here. It is recommended to look for the final on the weekends or in the evenings after business hours (9-5).

element.encoded-hints: 4: 2nd on the right, very (s)low; final:at the end of the line.

ul.li:
2010-05-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Toffee Man
Found this one after a few attempts. When we went to the final stage we were searching low down & after a nice hint from a fellow geocacher we some had the cache in hand. Good to get this one finshed. TFTF Toffee Man #344

2010-05-16T19:00:00Z : Found it by Blue Jay 59
Well this was a bit of a marathon for us [:O] Partly our own fault because I had a blonde moment at one of the earlier stages gathering the info, and partly because stage 4 was missing when we searched for it a couple of days. However, all's good and we found the cleverly hidden stage 4 & the final this evening. Glad to have this off our list [:D] Thanks for a great cache to creator and minder. Blue Jay 59 #344

2010-05-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by theswerve
Found the stages over about six months...could not find st4 for all the tea in China...found today...final location...all sorts of gougers around...found in the end....TFTC....

2010-05-06T22:57:00Z : Enable Listing by AbbeyAckbar
The cache is good to go! [:)] Stage 4 co-ords & formula changed slightly.

2010-05-06T19:00:00Z : Owner Maintenance by AbbeyAckbar
Stage 4 is now back to what it was and the final (which also went missing [:(] ) has been replaced in a new position, same co-ords. The container is now a small size. I want to double check everything before I re-enable the listing which will be soon!

wpt.name: GC1NFB3
wpt.desc: Stardust by toczygroszek (adopted by AbbeyAckbar), Multi-cache (2.5/1.5)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Stardust
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Tragedy:

The Stardust fire is one of the worst fires Dublin and Ireland has ever seen in modern times.
At 01:41 a.m. on Valentine's Day 1981 in the Stardust Nightclub in Artane (Butterly Business Park, Kilmore Road), while the club was full of people (about 841), inside the building the fire was noticed. It was claimed to have been started by a slashed seat cover allowing a flame to ignite the foam beneath, paper decorations for the Valentine's Night celebrations, causing the entire building to catch fire. In this tragedy 48 people died and 214 were injured.

Because some of the main fire exits turned out to be locked with padlocks and chains, people tried to escape through the men's toilets but the windows there had metal plates fixed on the inside and iron bars on the outside. Seven people died in the toilets while the fire services attempted to rescue them.

It is believed that the fire was caused by arson, what has never been proven.



Cache:

1st stage:
The coordinates will bring you to a plaque. You need to collect some information from the plaque:

1. How many letters "L" is on the plaque? Call it A.

Go to 2nd stage at coordinates:
N53° 23.795 W006° 12.486

2nd stage:
The coordinates will bring you to a sculpture with a plaque. You need to collect some information from the plaque:

1. How many letters "R" is on the plaque? Call it B.
2. How many letters "P" is on the plaque? Call it C.
3. How many letters "A" is on the plaque? Call it D.

Go to 3rd stage at coordinates:
N53° 23.ABC W006° 12.CAD

3rd stage:
The coordinates will bring you to another plaque. You need to collect some information from the plaque:

1. How many letters "V" is on the plaque? Call it E.
2. How many letters "G" is on the plaque? Call it F.
3. How many letters "W" is on the plaque? Call it G.

Go to 4th stage at coordinates:
N53° 23.AE(E+F) W006° 12.FF(C-G)

4th stage:
You need to find there well hidden coordinates for the final location.

Final location:
Final cache is hidden close to Butterly Business Park where Stardust Nightclub was existed. The cache is a small size container & includes a logbook with space for a couple of small items. Bring a writing tool
PLEASE rehide well to prevent it being muggled. This area is popular with children playing and hanging around here. It is recommended to look for the final on the weekends or in the evenings after business hours (9-5).





Additional Waypoints

FL1NFB3 - Final
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S21NFB3 - Stage 2
N 53° 23.795 W 006° 12.486

S31NFB3 - Stage 3
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

S41NFB3 - Stage 4
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___

However, all's good and we found the cleverly hidden stage 4 & the final this evening. Glad to have this off our list [:D] Thanks for a great cache to creator and minder. Blue Jay 59 #344
